intro: Heteropterys pteropetala var. mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Mattogrossense Guanin, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in the dense forest environment. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
